Issues.Title: fix(router): Remove deprecated ComponentFactoryResolver from APIs
Issues.Body:
BREAKING CHANGE:
`ComponentFactoryResolver` has been removed from Router APIs. Component factories are not required to create an instance of a component dynamically. Passing a factory resolver via resolver argument is no longer needed and code can instead use `ViewContainerRef.createComponent` without the factory resolver.
Issues.RelatedDescription: Open PR "fix(router): Remove deprecated ComponentFactoryResolver from APIs" (#49239)

Issues.Title: refactor(router): Remove zone code from router scroller
Issues.Body:
This zone code was added with the incorrect assumption that it would avoid scheduling a new change detection by creating the timeout outside of the Angular zone. However, it has recently been (re)discovered that calling `zone.run` when you are outside the angular zone results in a synchronous change detection. With that, this bit of code doesn't actually accomplish what it set out to do so it can be removed.

minimal repro: https://stackblitz.com/edit/angular-hbzbqs?file=src%2Fmain.ts
Issues.RelatedDescription: Open PR "refactor(router): Remove zone code from router scroller" (#49238)

Issues.Title: refactor(core): move TransferState implementation to core
Issues.Body:
This commit moves the `TransferState` class implementation to `@angular/core`. This class will be needed in `core` in followup changes (ðŸ’§) and `core` can not depend on `platform-browser` package.

The `core` package does **not** export those symbols into public API surface. The `platform-browser` package re-exports the symbols under same names for backwards-compatibility.

Issues.Title: Async validation in a ControlValueAccessor causes an ExpressionChangedAfterItHasBeenCheckedError
Issues.Body:
### Which @angular/* package(s) are the source of the bug? forms ### Is this a regression? No ### Description I ran into the issue that an ExpressionChangedAfterItHasBeenCheckedError was reported when a component was mounted. The template that caused the error was the valid property of a FormGroup `{{fg.valid}}` and I don't understand why. The FormGroup has a Component that implements ControlValueAccessor, Validator and uses async validation as its FormControl. The two relevant components are AppComponent and CvainputComponent. CvainputComponent implements ControlValueAccessor, Validator and has a FormControl with an async validator: ``` fg = new FormGroup({ name: new FormControl("", { validators:[Validators.required, Validators.min(5), Validators.max(50)], asyncValidators:[asyncEvenLength], nonNullable: true }) }) ``` The AppComponent has a FormGroup that uses the CvainputComponent: ``` fg = new FormGroup({ cvainp: new FormControl({name:'example'}) }) ``` The template of the AppComponent displays the validity of the FormGroup: ```

{{fg.valid}}

``` The template prints the validity twice. In this example only the first causes the ExpressionChangedAfterItHasBeenCheckedError. (But if I remember correctly in the original problem moving the expression didn't help). I'd say the ExpressionChangedAfterItHasBeenCheckedError should not be thrown. ### Please provide a link to a minimal reproduction of the bug https://github.com/krausest/angular-cva-async-issue ### Please provide the exception or error you saw ```true ERROR Error: NG0100: ExpressionChangedAfterItHasBeenCheckedError: Expression has changed after it was checked. Previous value: 'true'. Current value: 'false'. Find more at https://angular.io/errors/NG0100 ``` ### Please provide the environment you discovered this bug in (run `ng version`) ```true Angular CLI: 15.2.0 Node: 16.18.0 Package Manager: npm 8.19.2 OS: darwin arm64 Angular: 15.2.0 ... animations, cli, common, compiler, compiler-cli, core, forms ... platform-browser, platform-browser-dynamic, router Package Version --------------------------------------------------------- @angular-devkit/architect 0.1502.0 @angular-devkit/build-angular 15.2.0 @angular-devkit/core 15.2.0 @angular-devkit/schematics 15.2.0 @schematics/angular 15.2.0 rxjs 7.5.7 typescript 4.9.5 ``` ### Anything else? Due to #41519 the initial validity of the AppComponent gets stuck in the PENDING state. This can be fixed by adding ``` setTimeout(() => { this.fg.controls['name'].updateValueAndValidity(); }) ``` in `CvainputComponent.ngOnInit` I removed it from the example to make clear that the issue isn't caused by that update.
Issues.RelatedDescription: Open issue "Async validation in a ControlValueAccessor causes an ExpressionChangedAfterItHasBeenCheckedError" (#49237)

Issues.Title: feat(router): Expose information about the last successful `Navigation`
Issues.Body:
The `Router` already has the `getCurrentNavigation()` helper function to expose information about the ongoing navigation.
`lastSuccessfulNavigation` is actually already exposed in the `Navigation` object. This commit only _slightly_ extends the current API surface by providing access to the `lastSuccessfulNavigation` object outside of an ongoing navigation.

fixes #45685

Issues.Title: Bundle domino in @angular/platform-server package
Issues.Body:
Since we are not planning to publish our fork of domino to npm, we need to bundle it into the `@angular/platform-server` package rather than having our users depend on it via the repo directly.

In general, I believe that we should not be asking our users to install dependencies (a transitive one in this case) from a github repository rather than an npm registry package. Using a Github repo is a great option for internal packages, testing prior to publishing, etc., but I think we should be encouraging our users, and the ecosystem at large to be using a proper registry.  This is particularly true as we look forward to how [SLSA](https://slsa.dev/) specifications will be coming to the node ecosystem.
Issues.RelatedDescription: Open issue "Bundle domino in @angular/platform-server package" (#49228)

Issues.Title: perf(core): store producers and consumers in a linear array structure
Issues.Body:
This commit swaps out the `Map` storage for producers and consumers to use a
linear array as data structure, with keys being stored at even indices and
values at odd indices. The primary benefit of this data structure is that it
provides faster iteration.

Deleting elements inserts `null` values into both the key and value slots,
meaning that the array never shrinks in size. These empty slots are reused
when inserting new elements.

---

Based on top of #49216; only the fourth commit is new.
Issues.RelatedDescription: Open PR "perf(core): store producers and consumers in a linear array structure" (#49218)

Issues.Title: perf(core): prioritize checking the producer that marked a consumer as dirty
Issues.Body:
Each consumer that has been marked as stale has to verify if one of its
producers has actually changed in the pull phase of the reactivity algorithm.
This involves iterating over all producers to see if any of them reports an
actual value change.

This commit implements an optimization where the producer that marks a consumer
as dirty will be captured in the consumer, such that the consumer can
prioritize checking that particular producer. This is beneficial, since it is
a likely candidate to actually report a change.

---

Based on top of #49215; only the third commit is new.
Issues.RelatedDescription: Open PR "perf(core): prioritize checking the producer that marked a consumer as dirty" (#49216)

Issues.Title: perf(core): reduce effects queueing overhead
Issues.Body:
perf(core): reduce effects queueing overhead
This commit improves the performance of effect queuing and flushing by reducing
`Set` operations.

The work to queue an effect has been reduced by avoiding a `globalWatches`
lookup, in favor of reassigning the scheduling callback to a become a no-op.

Flushing the queue has been made more efficient by clearing all queued watches
at once, instead of individually per watched item. If an effect throws an error
then it will prevent the watch queue from being cleared at all, but the
internal dirty logic of `Watch` will prevent watches from executing multiple
times when the queue is flushed again.

---

Based on top of #49214; only the second commit is new.
Issues.RelatedDescription: Open PR "perf(core): reduce effects queueing overhead" (#49215)

Issues.Title: perf(core): lazily create promise needed to support `effectsDone`
Issues.Body:
The signals library used to eagerly create a promise to be able to notify when the effects queue had been flushed using `effectsDone()`. However, the creation of this promise is not without its cost (it shows up as significant cost in [js-reactivity-benchmark][1]), so this commit moves the creation to become lazy until `effectsDone()` has actually been called.

[1]: https://github.com/modderme123/js-reactivity-benchmark/
Issues.RelatedDescription: Open PR "perf(core): lazily create promise needed to support `effectsDone`" (#49214)

Issues.Title: Unable to provide services in an abstract Directive
Issues.Body:
### Which @angular/* package(s) are the source of the bug?

core

### Is this a regression?

No

### Description

I don't understand why this does nothing

```typescript
@Directive({
  providers: [CalendarComponentStateService]
})
export abstract class AbstractEventsComponent {

  calendarMonthEventsStateService = inject(CalendarComponentStateService);
```

Other than throw 

> NullInjectorError:
> R3InjectorError(EmployeeHubModule)[CalendarComponentStateService ->
> CalendarComponentStateService -> CalendarComponentStateService ->
> CalendarComponentStateService]:    NullInjectorError: No provider for
> CalendarComponentStateService!

I am required to provide in the concrete component class, which i don't really like.

```typescript
@Component({
  selector: 'app-events-calendar',
  templateUrl: './events-calendar.component.html',
  styleUrls: ['./events-calendar.component.scss'],
  changeDetection: ChangeDetectionStrategy.OnPush,
  providers: [CalendarComponentStateService]
})
export class EventsCalendarComponent extends AbstractEventsComponent {}
```

### Please provide a link to a minimal reproduction of the bug

_No response_

### Please provide the exception or error you saw

_No response_

Angular CLI: 14.2.3
Node: 16.18.0
Package Manager: npm 8.19.2
OS: win32 x64


_No response_

### Anything else?

_No response_

Issues.Title: feat(@schematics/angular): factor out logic from getRouterModuleDeclaration
Issues.Body:
Can now get module declarations of modules other than RouterModule. This is useful for adding a custom declaration to module using schematics. Checking the spec files will show a use case for this new feature, now the getModuleDeclarationByName function can be used to get the module declaration of a custom module, in this case ngxsModule.

## PR Checklist

Please check to confirm your PR fulfills the following requirements:

<!-- Please check all that apply using "x". -->

- [ x] The commit message follows our guidelines: https://github.com/angular/angular-cli/blob/main/CONTRIBUTING.md#-commit-message-guidelines
- [x ] Tests for the changes have been added (for bug fixes / features)
- [x ] Docs have been added / updated (for bug fixes / features)

## PR Type

What kind of change does this PR introduce?

<!-- Please check the one that applies to this PR using "x". -->

- [ ] Bugfix
- [x ] Feature
- [ ] Code style update (formatting, local variables)
- [ ] Refactoring (no functional changes, no api changes)
- [ ] Build related changes
- [ ] CI related changes
- [ ] Documentation content changes
- [ ] Other... Please describe:

## What is the current behavior?

The logic of getting module declaration was tied up in getRouterModuleDeclaration. This limits us from using that function to get other Modules.
On my personal project I am working on schematics that add new Ngxs States, including adding them to the NgxsModule in the NgModule.

Issues.Title: There are inconsistent and confusing postcss/autoprefixer warnings from "styles" in angular.json
Issues.Body:
### Command

build, serve

### Is this a regression?

- [X] Yes, this behavior used to work in the previous version

### The previous version in which this bug was not present was

_No response_

### Description

When seeing postcss/autoprefixer warnings from `ng serve` or `ng build`, the output of the where the warning is happening is hard to parse through. Also, the warnings do not consistently show up in the logs.

Regression details:
I know the filenames for the postcss/autoprefixer warnings used to display differently, so I would say that's a regression. I'm not sure whether that's directly related to angular-cli or a package it happens to depend on. 

As far as the issue with the warnings not always getting logged, I'm not sure which version this behavior changed.

I know that the behavior of both of these issues was different in @angular/cli 11. 

### Minimal Reproduction

repo: https://github.com/rsc092020/autoprefixer-warnings-14.git

steps:

- `ng new autoprefixer-warnings-14`

- Add css file, and update angular.json to include css file in "styles" array.

- run `ng serve` or `ng build` 

- Observe autoprefixer warning:

```
./styles2.css.webpack[javascript/auto]!=!./node_modules/css-loader/dist/cjs.js??ruleSet[1].rules[5].rules[0].oneOf[0].use[1]!./node_modules/postcss-loader/dist/cjs.js??ruleSet[1].rules[5].rules[0].oneOf[0].use[2]!./styles2.css - Warning: Module Warning (from ./node_modules/postcss-loader/dist/cjs.js):
Warning

(5:3) autoprefixer: You should write display: flex by final spec instead of display: box
```

- run `ng serve` or `ng build` again
- Observe that the build completed and no autoprefixer warning

**It appears that i can clean the build cache to get the warning to show up again, but there are other warnings, like for commonjs dependencies, that will always show up. I don't understand why these warnings are different.**

### Exception or Error

_No response_

### Your Environment

```text
Angular CLI: 14.2.10
Node: 16.19.0
Package Manager: npm 8.19.3
OS: win32 x64

Angular: 14.2.12
... animations, common, compiler, compiler-cli, core, forms
... platform-browser, platform-browser-dynamic, router

Package                         Version
---------------------------------------------------------
@angular-devkit/architect       0.1402.10
@angular-devkit/build-angular   14.2.10
@angular-devkit/core            14.2.10
@angular-devkit/schematics      14.2.10
@angular/cli                    14.2.10
@schematics/angular             14.2.10
rxjs                            7.5.7
typescript                      4.7.4
```


### Anything else relevant?

_No response_

Issues.Title: Angular CLI 15.1.4 breaks ng test with jsdom because CLI is loading JavaScript bundles as module
Issues.Body:
### Command

test

### Is this a regression?

- [X] Yes, this behavior used to work in the previous version

### The previous version in which this bug was not present was

15.1.3

### Description

I have a standard Angular project, using Karma & Jasmine for unit tests. The unit tests run can run in either Chrome or jsdom. I need jsdom because my CI environment doesn't have Chrome (org policy: no browsers on servers).

Angular CLI 15.1.4 introduced a change in https://github.com/angular/angular-cli/pull/24620 wherein Javascript bundles are loaded as modules. 

Unfortunately, jsdom doesn't support <script type="module">; it simply doesn't load the module scripts. This is a known issue in jsdom - https://github.com/jsdom/jsdom/issues/2475

Ideally jsdom would add module support; but since that ticket has been open for four years, I'm not holding out much hope. So instead, here's my request:

**REQUEST:** Could Angular CLI add a flag to add/omit type="module" ?

My workaround for now is patching jsdom (using patch-package) to ignore the type attribute on <script type="module">.

### Minimal Reproduction

Clone my git repo: https://github.com/andrewpmontgomery/angular-15-jsdom
1. Run `npm install`
2. Run `npm run test:chrome` and all three tests should pass.
3. Run `npm run test:jsdom` and it should time-out.
4. Run `npm run patch-package`
5. Run `npm run test:jsdom` again and now it works.


### Exception or Error

_No response_

### Your Environment

```text
Angular CLI: 15.2.0
Node: 16.19.1
Package Manager: npm 8.19.3
OS: win32 x64

Angular: 15.2.0
... animations, cli, common, compiler, compiler-cli, core, forms
... platform-browser, platform-browser-dynamic, router

Package                         Version
---------------------------------------------------------
@angular-devkit/architect       0.1502.0

@angular-devkit/core            15.2.0
@angular-devkit/schematics      15.2.0
@schematics/angular             15.2.0
```

Issues.Title: ES Build Angular - Uncaught TypeError: Class extends value undefined is not a constructor or null
Issues.Body:
### Command

build

### Is this a regression?

- [ ] Yes, this behavior used to work in the previous version

### The previous version in which this bug was not present was

_No response_

### Description

Hi Team,

I have just tried to build our large Angular using the new brower-esbuild and the Angular CLI 15.2.0.

The ng build command takes about 40 seconds and on the surface appears to finish outputing just some minor warnings.

However, when I attempt to run the app, I get the following error in the browser console and the app does not run -

```
Uncaught TypeError: Class extends value undefined is not a constructor or null
    at app.security.ts:19:7 
```

Which points to this line 

`export class AppSecurityModule extends BaseSecurityModule<AppSecurityRight> {`

Just some points about our code base.

1. We use typescript paths so we can reference our code using @jms/xxxx

Issues.Title: --exclude option for ng test not working
Issues.Body:
### Command

test

### Is this a regression?

- [ ] Yes, this behavior used to work in the previous version

### The previous version in which this bug was not present was

_No response_

### Description

Hi,

I'm trying to have 2 separate test runs, so i'm trying to include and exclude spec files.

I have this command to **include**
`ng test --watch=false --source-map=true --include='**/regression/*.spec.ts'`

Reading the [docs](https://angular.io/cli/test), I see **exclude** option, so using the same pattern:

`ng test --watch=false --source-map=true --code-coverage --exclude='**/regression/*.spec.ts'`

But i get the following error

```
ng test --watch=false --source-map=true --code-coverage --exclude='**/regression/*.spec.ts'

Error: Unknown argument: exclude

Process finished with exit code 1
```

I'm not sure if the docs are incorrect or if i'm doing something wrong? 

Any help would be much appreciated





### Minimal Reproduction

2. `ng test --watch=false --source-map=true --code-coverage --excludes='**/regression/*.spec.ts'`

Issues.Title: bug(cdk/scrolling): scrollToIndex in Angular lifecycle hooks
Issues.Body:
### Is this a regression?

- [ ] Yes, this behavior used to work in the previous version

### The previous version in which this bug was not present was

_No response_

### Description

Trying to automatically scroll to a specific item in the CdkVirtualScrollViewport when loading an Angular component using the `scrollToIndex(index: number, behavior = 'auto')` method.  I have tried placing the `scrollToIndex` method in various lifecycle hooks, `ngOnInit`, `ngAfterContentInit`, `ngAfterViewInit`, and `ngAfterViewInit`.

`scrollToIndex` inside of `ngOnInit`, `ngAfterContentInit`, or `ngAfterViewInit` do nothing and no errors thrown.

`ngAfterViewInit` of course fires multiple times and trying to limit the `scrollToIndex` to only firing the first time does not work and no errors thrown.

How would one scroll to the index of an item after the page loads without using `setTimeout`? _Perhaps I am just using it wrong?_

### Reproduction

Steps to reproduce:
1. Providing an example with the different lifecycle hooks:  https://stackblitz.com/edit/angular-cdk-programatically-scroll-4kwju2?file=app%2Fcdk-virtual-scroll-fixed-buffer-example.ts



### Expected Behavior

Expect to be able to scroll to an item in Angular lifecycle hooks (other than ngAfterViewChecked which fires multiple times).

### Actual Behavior

`scrollToIndex` does nothing and no errors when used in lifecycle hooks.

### Environment

- Angular: latest
- CDK/Material: latest
- Browser(s): Chrome
- Operating System (e.g. Windows, macOS, Ubuntu): Windows and/or macOS
Issues.RelatedDescription: Open issue "bug(cdk/scrolling): scrollToIndex in Angular lifecycle hooks" (#26702)

Issues.Title: bug(option): mat-options with long text lack of gap since v15
Issues.Body:
### Is this a regression?

- [X] Yes, this behavior used to work in the previous version

### The previous version in which this bug was not present was

14

### Description

Before v15, `mat-option`s with long text were truncated so their height was always 48px and naturally, a gap was there to well separate each option.

Now the text is no more truncated but a min-height of 48px is applied. If the text of a `mat-option` take only one line the gap remains and there is no problem. But with 2 lines of more, the gap is no more and reading becomes more difficult

### Reproduction

https://stackblitz.com/edit/angular-hjwez5?file=src/styles.scss

### Expected Behavior

![image](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/23034761/221603790-430f1dbb-2142-409d-b93f-07d719ef8216.png)

```css
.mat-mdc-option {
  padding-top: 12px;
  padding-bottom: 12px;
  box-sizing: border-box;
}
```

### Actual Behavior

![image](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/23034761/221603654-56faf2c9-17e7-4fda-9af6-b95369301b1b.png)


### Environment

- Angular: 15.2.0
- CDK/Material: 15.2.0
- Browser(s): All
- Operating System (e.g. Windows, macOS, Ubuntu): All
Issues.RelatedDescription: Open issue "bug(option): mat-options with long text lack of gap since v15" (#26701)

Issues.Title: bug(mat-chip): Cannot shift+tab out of a focused mat-chip-listbox
Issues.Body:
### Is this a regression?

- [X] Yes, this behavior used to work in the previous version

### The previous version in which this bug was not present was

14.2.7

### Description

When focused in a `<mat-chip-listbox>` a user cannot shift+tab to the previous element. 

### Reproduction

Steps to reproduce:
1. Tab to `<mat-chip-listbox>`
2. Try shift+tab to tab out of the `<mat-chip-listbox>`

[Stackblitz](https://stackblitz.com/edit/angular-mdoiwo?file=src%2Fapp%2Fchips-overview-example.html)

### Expected Behavior

A user should be able to press shift+tab to focus back to the previous element.

### Actual Behavior

When pressing shift+tab, the focus remains on a the `<mat-chip-listbox>`. If a value is selected, then the focus returns to that selected `<mat-chip>`.

### Environment

- Angular: 15
- CDK/Material: 15.2
- Browser(s): Chrome, Edge, Firefox
- Operating System (e.g. Windows, macOS, Ubuntu): Windows

Issues.Title: bug(mat-chip): ngIf on matChipRemove breaks style
Issues.Body:
### Is this a regression?

- [ ] Yes, this behavior used to work in the previous version

### The previous version in which this bug was not present was

_No response_

### Description

Hi,
When using the `mat-chip` with a button that has the `matChipRemove` directive combined with the `*ngIf` structural directive, as the condition changes from true / false, the `mat-chip` does not seem to correctly handle the state change in it's css styling.



### Reproduction

Steps to reproduce:
1. add a mat-chip in your template

2. add a button with an `matChipRemove` directive and an `*ngIf` directive that resolves a condition
![image](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/8459019/221306084-d0d6f30f-0901-4f61-b033-93cc376dd209.png)

3. change the condition value so the button is removed/added to the DOM
![image](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/8459019/221306354-9a0633d3-fcd7-48c0-8161-0b7339049fcb.png)

Notice that the padding of the chips does not reflect the state.

Demo: https://stackblitz.com/edit/angular-6ngj4w?file=src%2Fapp%2Fchips-overview-example.html

### Expected Behavior

Should apply correct styling (ex: padding)

### Actual Behavior

The text and size of the padding are broken after a structural change

### Environment

- Angular: 15.2.0
- CDK/Material: 15.2.0
- Browser(s): Chrome latest
- Operating System (e.g. Windows, macOS, Ubuntu): Windows

Issues.Title: help(map-directions-renderer):  Can't display multiple routes
Issues.Body:
### Is this a regression?

- [ ] Yes, this behavior used to work in the previous version

### The previous version in which this bug was not present was

_No response_

### Description

hi real beginner here with this but i'm trying to display all the routes on the maps using the below as per the documentation within the html:
`<map-directions-renderer *ngIf="(dResultTransit | async) as directionsResults1" [directions]="directionsResults1"></map-directions-renderer>`

i have the request to provide route alternatives:
`    let request: google.maps.DirectionsRequest = {
      origin: this.origin,
      destination: this.destination,
      travelMode: google.maps.TravelMode.TRANSIT,
      provideRouteAlternatives: true,
      transitOptions: {
        modes: transitMode,
        routingPreference: this.transitPreference
      },
    }
`

this is followed with providing the dResultTransit as defined:
`  dResultTransit: Observable<google.maps.DirectionsResult | undefined> | undefined;`

`this.dResultTransit = this.DirectionsServiceTransit.route(this.TransitRequest()).pipe(map(response => response.result));`






### Reproduction

Steps to reproduce:
1.  I tried different travel modes and turning off the provide route alternatives to ensure the displaying of the routes is correct
2. I tried using different machines and os and i am getting the same result

### Expected Behavior

I expect 4 routes to be displayed as per below
![image](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/81580209/221355667-1dff1430-6797-40f9-8cac-227ae42abb1c.png)


### Actual Behavior

however, this is only currently displaying 1 route.
![image](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/81580209/221355705-032cd3fe-0397-4625-878d-79b6477631bf.png)




### Environment

- Angular: 15.0.5
- CDK/Material: 15.1.4
- Browser(s): Google Chrome
- Operating System (e.g. Windows, macOS, Ubuntu): macOS and Windows
Issues.RelatedDescription: Open issue "help(map-directions-renderer):  Can't display multiple routes" (#26693)

Issues.Title: bug(mat-stepper): MatStepper and MatStep not working through content projection
Issues.Body:
### Is this a regression?

- [ ] Yes, this behavior used to work in the previous version

### The previous version in which this bug was not present was

_No response_

### Description

Hello. I'm not sure if this is by design, but I'd expect this code to work. MatStepper is already using `descendants: true` in it's `@ContentChildren` query so I'd assume this is allowed.

```ts
import 'zone.js/dist/zone';
import { Component } from '@angular/core';
import { CommonModule } from '@angular/common';
import { bootstrapApplication } from '@angular/platform-browser';
import { MatStepperModule } from '@angular/material/stepper';

@Component({
  selector: 'my-app-stepper-container',
  standalone: true,
  imports: [MatStepperModule],
  template: `
  <mat-stepper>
    <ng-content></ng-content>
  </mat-stepper>
  `
})
export class StepperContainer {}

@Component({
  selector: 'my-app',
  standalone: true,
  imports: [CommonModule, MatStepperModule, StepperContainer],
  template: `
    <my-app-stepper-container>
      <mat-step>my step</mat-step>
    </my-app-stepper-container>
  `,
})
export class App {
  name = 'Angular';
}

bootstrapApplication(App);
```
```
ERROR
Error: R3InjectorError(Standalone[App])[MatStepper -> MatStepper -> MatStepper]:
NullInjectorError: No provider for MatStepper!
```

### Reproduction

Steps to reproduce:
https://stackblitz.com/edit/angular-tnkyk1?devToolsHeight=33&file=src/main.ts

### Expected Behavior

`MatStepper` and `MatStep` work through content projection.

### Actual Behavior

`NullInjectorError` is thrown.

### Environment

- Angular: 15.2.0
- CDK/Material: 15.2.0
- Browser(s): Chrome 110.0.5481.177 (Official Build) (x86_64)
- Operating System (e.g. Windows, macOS, Ubuntu): macOS
Issues.RelatedDescription: Open issue "bug(mat-stepper): MatStepper and MatStep not working through content projection" (#26690)

Issues.Title: bug(component): No documentation for style overriding
Issues.Body:
### Is this a regression?

- [ ] Yes, this behavior used to work in the previous version

### The previous version in which this bug was not present was

_No response_

### Description

I have a styling library which styles all material components based on a given desing specs.  But material v15 has migrated all angular components styles to [MDC components](https://github.com/material-components/material-components-web) which broke all our extisting styles because of DOM structure change.

Now we are again planning to styles all MDC components but this time we want to follow future proof styling path but I don't see any document which I can follow and add extensive styles on top of MDC styles.

I can see material now using `--mdc-*` custom properties for all components and using those variables I can override the styles but I don't see any documentation for the same.

Angular material now using [MDC](https://m2.material.io/components/) styles but MDC suggesting [Material Design 3](https://github.com/material-components/material-web) which is yet another web component library based on Lit.

Does Angular material continue using [MDC](https://m2.material.io/components/) components styles or planning to use  [Material Design 3](https://github.com/material-components/material-web) styles. 

What should be the best path for such users who want to override styles on top of Angular material library.

### Reproduction

NA

### Expected Behavior

There should be a proper documentation for style overriding 

### Actual Behavior

NA

### Environment

- Angular:
- CDK/Material:
- Browser(s):
- Operating System (e.g. Windows, macOS, Ubuntu):

Issues.Title: bug(google-maps): google.maps.ControlPosition.RIGHT_TOP returning undefined when pushing measure distance widget
Issues.Body:
### Is this a regression?

- [ ] Yes, this behavior used to work in the previous version

### The previous version in which this bug was not present was

_No response_

### Description

We are running some unit tests for our google map component where the tests seem to fail due to `google.maps.ControlPosition.RIGHT_TOP` returning undefined when trying to push the measure distance widget element in our `ngAfterViewInit()` function like so: `this.map.controls[google.maps.ControlPosition.RIGHT_TOP].push(measureDistanceWidgetRootElement)`

where `measureDistanceWidgetRootElement` is defined as a native element:
`this.measureDistanceWidget.map = this.map.googleMap!`
`let measureDistanceWidgetRootElement = this.measureDistanceWidget.element.nativeElement`

Error output:
`TypeError: Cannot read properties of undefined (reading 'push')`

However, all the tests pass once we change the control position to a value that does not return undefined, like `google.maps.ControlPosition.RIGHT_BOTTOM`. This behavior is only observed when running the unit tests and not while the application is running, the measure distance widget works as expected. Therefore, we want to know why some control positions are returning undefined while others are not and if this error could be replicated.

### Reproduction

Steps to reproduce:

Create a measure distance widget component and try pushing it to the RIGHT_TOP control position in ngAfterViewInit() as a native element, something like this:

`this.measureDistanceWidget.map = this.map.googleMap!
let measureDistanceWidgetRootElement = this.measureDistanceWidget.element.nativeElement
this.map.controls[google.maps.ControlPosition.RIGHT_TOP].push(
            measureDistanceWidgetRootElement
        )`

### Expected Behavior

`google.maps.ControlPosition.RIGHT_TOP` should not return undefined and the unit tests pass.

### Actual Behavior

`google.maps.ControlPosition.RIGHT_TOP` returns undefined and the unit tests fail.`

### Environment

- Angular CLI: 13.3.10
- Node: 16.14.0
- Package Manager: npm 8.3.1
- Browser(s): Google Chrome
- Operating System (e.g. Windows, macOS, Ubuntu): Windows 64 bit

Package                         Version
---------------------------------------------------------
@angular-devkit/architect       0.1303.10
@angular-devkit/build-angular   13.3.10
@angular-devkit/core            13.3.10
@angular-devkit/schematics      13.3.10
@angular/cdk                    13.3.9
@angular/cli                    13.3.10
@angular/flex-layout            13.0.0-beta.38
@angular/google-maps            13.3.9
@angular/material               13.3.9
@schematics/angular             13.3.10
rxjs                            7.8.0
typescript                      4.6.4
Issues.RelatedDescription: Open issue "bug(google-maps): google.maps.ControlPosition.RIGHT_TOP returning undefined when pushing measure distance widget" (#26682)

Issues.Title: bug(cdk-menu): cdkMenuTriggerFor within cdkContextMenuTriggerFor causes repositioning when hovered
Issues.Body:
### Is this a regression?

- [ ] Yes, this behavior used to work in the previous version

### The previous version in which this bug was not present was

_No response_

### Description

Using a `[cdkMenuTriggerFor]` within a container that has a `[cdkContextMenuTriggerFor]` for the same cdkMenu.

Current behavior:
 When a cdkMenu is opened by the `[cdkContextMenuTriggerFor]` the cdkMenu it will be repositioned to the `[cdkMenuTriggerFor]` when the `[cdkMenuTriggerFor]` is hovered.

Expected behavior:
the cdkMenu should stay at its current location, even if `[cdkMenuTriggerFor]` is hovered.

In case this is confirmed as a bug, I could provide a PR fixing the issue

### Reproduction

Stackblitz: https://stackblitz.com/edit/components-issue-uo4741?file=src/app/example-component.html

Steps to reproduce:
1. Right click on Lucas ipsum
2. hover Open Context Menu button


### Expected Behavior

contextMenu does not change position

### Actual Behavior

contextMenu moves to the location of the button trigger

### Environment

- Angular: 15
- CDK/Material: 15
- Browser(s): Firefox, Chrome
- Operating System (e.g. Windows, macOS, Ubuntu): Ubuntu

Can also be reproduced with the dev-app in the components repo
Issues.RelatedDescription: Open issue "bug(cdk-menu): cdkMenuTriggerFor within cdkContextMenuTriggerFor causes repositioning when hovered" (#26675)
